definition: to read/to study (a subject)/to attend (a school)/to read aloud/to give (sb) a tongue-lashing (CL:頓|顿[dun4])/to miss (sb)/idea/remembrance/twenty (banker's anti-fraud numeral corresponding to 廿[nian4])
variant of 念[nian4], to read aloud
head/hair style/the top/end/beginning or end/a stub/remnant/chief/boss/side/aspect/first/leading/classifier for pigs or livestock/CL:個|个[ge4]

sentences.english: She gets a chance to act out her fantasies.
sentences.chinese: 她得到了一个把她的怪念头付诸行动的机会。

sentences.english: A sudden whim to buy a cream cake.
sentences.chinese: 去买奶油蛋糕的一个突然的怪念头，。

sentences.english: He had a sudden whim to take a midnight walk.
sentences.chinese: 他有一个突然的怪念头，半夜里散步。

sentences.english: She is always full of whims and fancies.
Amy seized any chance to act out her fantasies.
sentences.chinese: 艾美抓住任何机会把她的怪念头付诸行动。

sentences.english: He always has some weird ideas.

definition: variant of 莫名其妙[mo4 ming2 qi2 miao4]
see 胡思亂想|胡思乱想[hu2 si1 luan4 xiang3]
to indulge in flights of fancy (idiom)/to let one's imagination run wild
absolutely ridiculous (idiom); preposterous/the height of folly
practical joke/prank/to play a practical joke
see 有的沒的|有的没的[you3 de5 mei2 de5]
to remain puzzled after pondering over sth a hundred times (idiom)/to remain perplexed despite much thought
